intro: Noccaea tymphaea, commonly known as water pennywort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds, streams, and ditches. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along its stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, consisting of four petals, and it produces small, round seeds. Noccaea tymphaea plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
